results.title: Cyberthon V: Spectrum 7 - Violet
results.brief_description:
Cyberthon V: Spectrum 7 – Violet was broadcast as the seventh of eight in an episodic series on Channel 31 in Melbourne. This format allowed for the creation of tighter, curated segments for broadcast instead of the impromptu, marathon-like events of the previous Cyberthons.

As well as electronic music, art, remixed footage (from previous Cyberthon events), guerrilla style music videos, drug and rave safe promotions, experimental performances and short films, global participation was also encouraged via online production meetings. As Cyberthon curator Adem Jaffers said “Cyberthon had become a public TV ‘Access Show’ nested within a public TV ‘Access Channel’ [which was] quite unique really!”

A selection of artists: Tekno Mandala (Adem Jaffers), Future Films (Jeff Jaffers), Third Eye ‘Ambi Jam’ (Gus Till, Ollie Olsen, Geoffrey Hales, Simon Polinski), Cyberdada (Troy Innocent & Dale Nason), Phuture (Crissie Seivers and M. Buchanan ‘Equinox Comics’), Stelarc, Theatre TV (Eliza, Mari Giambanco and Julie Turner), Space Between the Gaps (Paul Gafney), Corruption & Vice (Ju-Ann Lam), abcTVxyz (Dale Nason and Kim Bounds) and Dont Shoot The Messenger (Steve Middleton)

Cyberthon VII: Spectrum 7 – Violet is part of the Cyberthon Archive generously donated to ACMI by Adem Jaffers.

results.title: Jafar's blue tiles (Iran)
results.creator_credit: Paul Saltzman, Deepa Mehta and Sunrise Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
The restoration of a 600-year-old brick dome in his village is the focal point of fourteen-year-old Jafar’s interests and activities as he is seen making and installing twelve richly colored tiles that adorn the dome. Told from Jafar’s point of view, explains the significance of the project and the brickmaking process in the culture and customs of his country and captures vistas of the Iranian landscape.

results.title: Ecstasy = Ekstase
results.brief_description: This controversial Czech film, featuring a very young Hedy Lamarr, gained international notoriety for its loose morals and a lengthy nude sequence. It was banned in America, Britain and Germany.

constellations_other.name: Weaponising glamour
constellations_other.description: Josephine Baker wasn't just a star, she was a spy with the French Resistance during the German occupation of France during WWII. She wasn't the only celebrity to weaponise her glamour.

results.description: This controversial Czech film, featuring a very young Hedy Lamarr, gained international notoriety for its loose morals and a lengthy nude sequence. It was banned in America, Britain and Germany. The story follows a young woman’s search for love and fulfillment after she marries an unloving and much older man. Eventually she leaves him to return to the family home where she falls in love with a handsome young surveyor, but her husband discovers the affair and takes drastic action. The story is straightforward melodrama but an effortless sensuality and remarkable cinematography give the film a freshness and eloquence that is quite special.
description_for_label: This controversial Czech film, featuring a very young Hedy Lamarr, gained international notoriety for its loose morals and a lengthy nude sequence. It was banned in America, Britain and Germany. The story follows a young woman’s search for love and fulfillment after she marries an unloving and much older man. Eventually she leaves him to return to the family home where she falls in love with a handsome young surveyor, but her husband discovers the affair and takes drastic action. The story is straightforward melodrama but an effortless sensuality and remarkable cinematography give the film a freshness and eloquence that is quite special.

results.title: Valerie's stained glass window (France)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
The town of Chatres near Paris, with its famous cathedral, is the home of sixteen year old Valerie Foucault, an apprentice in the craft of stained glass. As well as showing Valerie learning some of the techniques of this ancient craft, and creating her first stained glass window, the film provides background information on aspects of French history and civilization.

results.title: Gopal's golden pendant: India
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
Looks at a family in Jaipur, India, whose members are master craftsmen in the art of enamelling gold and silver. In particular, the film focuses on a ten-year-old boy who has been learning the craft since he was six. Suitable for lower secondary level.
results.description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.

results.title: Kurtis: Hollywood stuntboy
results.creator_credit: Paul Quigley, Peter Rowe and Sunrise Films Ltd
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
Kurtis Sanders is a 12 year old stuntman. The film shows stunts Kurtis and his family perform for a television special illustrating stuntwork. It also shows original footage of old westerns in which Kurtis’s grandfather was a stuntman.

results.title: Serama's mask
results.creator_credit: Paul Saltzman, Deepa Saltzman and Sunrise Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”
Serama, a Balinese boy, has been learning the intricate, ancient art of the Balinese dance since he was seven. His teacher is his father, a master dancer. They practice for a dance that will be the father’s final performance, and mark his son as his replacement.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Saltzman, Deepa Saltzman and Sunrise Films

results.title: Yoshiko the Papermaker (Japan)
results.creator_credit: Paul Saltzman, Deepa Mehta and Sunrise Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
Yoshiko Fujimoto, thirteen, lives in the tiny mountain village of Obara-Mura which retains its seven hundred year old traditions for unique handmade paper panels. Yoshiko learns this ancient art from a local master.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Saltzman, Deepa Mehta and Sunrise Films

results.title: Slima the dhowmaker: Tanzania
results.creator_credit: Paul Saltzman, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Sunrise Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
A Tanzanian teenager is apprenticed to a dhow-builder and learns skills unchanged for two thousand years. The film shows the building of a boat and the ceremony surrounding its launching.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Saltzman, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Sunrise Films
